title: Learning the Intrinsic Dimensionality of Fermi-Pasta-Ulam-Tsingou Trajectories: A Nonlinear Approach using a Deep Autoencoder Model
summary: We address the intrinsic dimensionality (ID) of high-dimensional trajectories, comprising $n_s = 4\,000\,000$ data points, of the Fermi-Pasta-Ulam-Tsingou (FPUT) $β$ model with $N = 32$ oscillators. To this end, a deep autoencoder (DAE) model is employed to infer the ID in the weakly nonlinear regime ($β\lesssim 1$). We find that the trajectories lie on a nonlinear manifold of dimension $m^{\ast} = 2$ embedded in a $64$-dimensional phase space. The DAE further reveals that this dimensionality increases to $m^{\ast} = 3$ at $β= 1.1$, coinciding with a symmetry breaking transition, in which additional energy modes with even wave numbers $k = 2, 4$ become excited. Finally, we discuss the limitations of the linear approach based on principal component analysis (PCA), which fails to capture the underlying structure of the data and therefore yields unreliable results in most cases.

AI.tldr: 本文利用深度自编码器模型研究了 Fermi-Pasta-Ulam-Tsingou (FPUT) β模型中高维轨迹的内在维度，发现其维度随非线性参数变化，并指出传统的基于主成分分析 (PCA) 的方法存在局限性。
AI.motivation: 为了理解FPUT模型中非线性动力学和确定性混沌现象，特别是能量复现现象，本文旨在更准确地确定高维轨迹的内在维度，并评估线性方法（PCA）的适用性。
AI.method: 研究人员使用深度自编码器 (DAE) 模型来推断FPUT β模型（N=32 oscillators）中包含ns=4 000 000数据点的轨迹的内在维度。同时，对比分析了PCA方法的结果。
AI.result: DAE模型发现，在弱非线性区域（β≲1）时，轨迹位于一个维度为m∗=2的非线性流形上。当β=1.1时，随着对称性破缺和额外能量模式的激发，维度增加到m∗=3。
AI.conclusion: 本文表明，深度自编码器模型能够更准确地捕捉FPUT轨迹的内在结构，而传统的PCA方法由于其线性假设，在描述此类非线性系统时存在局限性，可能导致不可靠的结果。该研究为理解FPUT模型的非线性动力学提供了新的视角。

title: Reinforcement Learning for Quantum Technology
summary: Many challenges arising in Quantum Technology can be successfully addressed using a set of machine learning algorithms collectively known as reinforcement learning (RL), based on adaptive decision-making through interaction with the quantum device. After a concise and intuitive introduction to RL aimed at a broad physics readership, we discuss the key ideas and core concepts in reinforcement learning with a particular focus on quantum systems. We then survey recent progress in RL in all relevant areas. We discuss state preparation in few- and many-body quantum systems, the design and optimization of high-fidelity quantum gates, and the automated construction of quantum circuits, including applications to variational quantum eigensolvers and architecture search. We further highlight the interactive capabilities of RL agents, emphasizing recent progress in quantum feedback control and quantum error correction, and briefly discuss quantum reinforcement learning as well as applications to quantum metrology. The review concludes with a discussion of open challenges -- such as scalability, interpretability, and integration with experimental platforms -- and outlines promising directions for future research. Throughout, we highlight experimental implementations that exemplify the increasing role of reinforcement learning in shaping the development of quantum technologies.

AI.tldr: 本文综述了强化学习（RL）在量子技术中的应用，涵盖了量子态制备、量子门设计、量子电路设计、量子反馈控制、量子纠错、量子强化学习和量子计量学等多个领域，并探讨了未来的挑战和研究方向。
AI.motivation: 量子技术的开发面临诸多挑战，例如噪声鲁棒的态制备、高保真度量子门的工程设计、量子电路编译等。强化学习作为一种自适应决策算法，有望解决这些问题。
AI.method: 本文首先介绍了强化学习的基本概念和核心思想，然后系统地回顾了强化学习在量子系统中的应用进展，包括量子最优控制、量子态制备、量子门实现、量子电路设计、量子反馈控制、量子纠错、量子强化学习和量子计量学等。
AI.result: 本文总结了强化学习在量子技术各个领域取得的最新进展，例如在量子态制备、量子门优化、量子电路搜索、量子反馈控制和量子纠错等方面都取得了显著成果。
AI.conclusion: 强化学习在量子技术领域展现出巨大的潜力，有望加速量子技术的开发进程。未来的研究方向包括提高可扩展性、增强可解释性以及与实验平台的集成。

title: Contrast-Source-Based Physics-Driven Neural Network for Inverse Scattering Problems
summary: Deep neural networks (DNNs) have recently been applied to inverse scattering problems (ISPs) due to their strong nonlinear mapping capabilities. However, supervised DNN solvers require large-scale datasets, which limits their generalization in practical applications. Untrained neural networks (UNNs) address this issue by updating weights from measured electric fields and prior physical knowledge, but existing UNN solvers suffer from long inference time. To overcome these limitations, this paper proposes a contrast-source-based physics-driven neural network (CSPDNN), which predicts the induced current distribution to improve efficiency and incorporates an adaptive total variation loss for robust reconstruction under varying contrast and noise conditions. The improved imaging performance is validated through comprehensive numerical simulations and experimental data.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于对比源的物理驱动神经网络（CSPDNN）来解决逆散射问题，该网络预测诱导电流分布，并通过自适应总变分损失提高鲁棒性，显著提高了计算效率。
AI.motivation: 现有深度神经网络求解器需要大规模数据集，且未经训练的神经网络（UNN）虽然避免了数据依赖，但推理时间长。为了克服这些限制，需要一种更高效且鲁棒的解决方案。
AI.method: CSPDNN通过预测诱导电流分布来避免显式矩阵求逆，并引入自适应总变分损失来调整不同对比度和噪声条件下的重建效果。网络结构基于对比源，利用物理知识指导网络参数更新。
AI.result: 通过全面的数值模拟和实验验证，CSPDNN在准确性和计算效率方面均表现出优异的性能，尤其是在复杂结构和不同噪声水平下。
AI.conclusion: CSPDNN为解决逆散射问题提供了一种高效且鲁棒的解决方案，有望应用于非破坏性检测、机场安全检查和地下探测等实际应用。

title: Transformer Learning of Chaotic Collective Dynamics in Many-Body Systems
summary: Learning reduced descriptions of chaotic many-body dynamics is fundamentally challenging: although microscopic equations are Markovian, collective observables exhibit strong memory and exponential sensitivity to initial conditions and prediction errors. We show that a self-attention-based transformer framework provides an effective approach for modeling such chaotic collective dynamics directly from time-series data. By selectively reweighting long-range temporal correlations, the transformer learns a non-Markovian reduced description that overcomes intrinsic limitations of conventional recurrent architectures. As a concrete demonstration, we study the one-dimensional semiclassical Holstein model, where interaction quenches induce strongly nonlinear and chaotic dynamics of the charge-density-wave order parameter. While pointwise predictions inevitably diverge at long times, the transformer faithfully reproduces the statistical "climate" of the chaos, including temporal correlations and characteristic decay scales. Our results establish self-attention as a powerful mechanism for learning effective reduced dynamics in chaotic many-body systems.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于Transformer的框架，可以直接从时间序列数据中学习混沌多体系统的集体动力学，有效克服了传统循环神经网络的局限性。
AI.motivation: 现有机器学习方法在学习复杂量子和混合量子-经典系统动力学方面取得了进展，但大多集中在相对简单的耗散和振荡行为上。对于封闭系统的集体可观测量，其动力学通常是非马尔可夫的，且混沌状态下对初始条件的敏感性使得长时预测变得困难，需要能够学习长程时间结构和稳健统计规律的模型。
AI.method: 研究人员利用基于自注意力机制的Transformer框架，直接从时间序列数据中建模混沌集体动力学。Transformer通过选择性地重新加权长程时间相关性，学习非马尔可夫的简化描述。以一维半经典Holstein模型为例，研究了相互作用淬火诱导的电荷密度波序参量的强烈非线性混沌动力学。
AI.result: Transformer能够忠实地再现混沌的统计“气候”，包括时间相关性和特征衰减尺度，即使点预测在长时间内会发散。实验结果表明，自注意力机制是学习混沌多体系统中有效简化动力学的强大机制。
AI.conclusion: 本文的研究表明，Transformer架构是一种有效的方法，可以学习混沌多体系统的简化动力学，为利用机器学习技术研究复杂物理系统提供了新的思路。

title: PCEvo: Path-Consistent Molecular Representation via Virtual Evolutionary
summary: Molecular representation learning aims to learn vector embeddings that capture molecular structure and geometry, thereby enabling property prediction and downstream scientific applications. In many AI for science tasks, labeled data are expensive to obtain and therefore limited in availability. Under the few-shot setting, models trained with scarce supervision often learn brittle structure-property relationships, resulting in substantially higher prediction errors and reduced generalization to unseen molecules. To address this limitation, we propose PCEvo, a path-consistent representation method that learns from virtual paths through dynamic structural evolution. PCEvo enumerates multiple chemically feasible edit paths between retrieved similar molecular pairs under topological dependency constraints. It transforms the labels of the two molecules into stepwise supervision along each virtual evolutionary path. It introduces a path-consistency objective that enforces prediction invariance across alternative paths connecting the same two molecules. Comprehensive experiments on the QM9 and MoleculeNet datasets demonstrate that PCEvo substantially improves the few-shot generalization performance of baseline methods. The code is available at https://anonymous.4open.science/r/PCEvo-4BF2.

AI.tldr: PCEvo提出了一种新的分子表示学习方法，通过模拟分子结构动态演化过程中的虚拟路径，实现更好的小样本泛化性能。该方法通过路径一致性目标，强制模型在不同路径上保持预测一致性。
AI.motivation: 现有分子表示学习方法在小样本场景下容易过拟合，且缺乏对分子结构局部编辑与性质变化的建模，导致泛化能力不足。
AI.method: PCEvo通过枚举分子对之间的化学可行编辑路径，将两个分子的标签转化为沿虚拟演化路径的逐步监督，并引入路径一致性目标，确保在不同路径上预测结果的一致性。
AI.result: 在QM9和MoleculeNet数据集上的实验表明，PCEvo显著提升了小样本泛化性能，优于现有基线方法。
AI.conclusion: PCEvo提供了一种有效的分子表示学习框架，通过模拟分子演化路径，提高了模型在小样本场景下的鲁棒性和泛化能力，为药物发现等科学应用提供了新的思路。

title: EnzyPGM: Pocket-conditioned Generative Model for Substrate-specific Enzyme Design
summary: Designing enzymes with substrate-binding pockets is a critical challenge in protein engineering, as catalytic activity depends on the precise interaction between pockets and substrates. Currently, generative models dominate functional protein design but cannot model pocket-substrate interactions, which limits the generation of enzymes with precise catalytic environments. To address this issue, we propose EnzyPGM, a unified framework that jointly generates enzymes and substrate-binding pockets conditioned on functional priors and substrates, with a particular focus on learning accurate pocket-substrate interactions. At its core, EnzyPGM includes two main modules: a Residue-atom Bi-scale Attention (RBA) that jointly models intra-residue dependencies and fine-grained interactions between pocket residues and substrate atoms, and a Residue Function Fusion (RFF) that incorporates enzyme function priors into residue representations. Also, we curate EnzyPock, an enzyme-pocket dataset comprising 83,062 enzyme-substrate pairs across 1,036 four-level enzyme families. Extensive experiments demonstrate that EnzyPGM achieves state-of-the-art performance on EnzyPock. Notably, EnzyPGM reduces the average binding energy of 0.47 kcal/mol over EnzyGen, showing its superior performance on substrate-specific enzyme design. The code and dataset will be released later.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为EnzyPGM的框架，用于联合生成酶和底物结合口袋，并特别关注学习准确的口袋-底物相互作用，从而实现底物特异性酶的设计。
AI.motivation: 现有生成模型在功能性蛋白质设计中表现出色，但无法有效建模口袋-底物相互作用，限制了精确催化环境的酶生成。因此，需要一种能够联合建模酶和口袋，并准确捕捉口袋-底物相互作用的方法。
AI.method: EnzyPGM框架包含两个主要模块：Residue-atom Bi-scale Attention (RBA) 用于联合建模残基依赖性和口袋残基与底物原子之间的精细相互作用，以及Residue Function Fusion (RFF) 用于将酶功能先验信息融入残基表示中。同时，构建了包含83,062个酶-底物对的EnzyPock数据集。
AI.result: 在EnzyPock数据集上，EnzyPGM实现了最先进的性能，并将EnzyGen的平均结合能降低了0.47 kcal/mol，表明其在底物特异性酶设计方面的优越性能。
AI.conclusion: EnzyPGM为底物特异性酶的设计提供了一种有效的方法，通过精确建模口袋-底物相互作用，能够生成具有更优催化性能的酶，为蛋白质工程领域的研究提供了新的思路。

title: Configurable p-Neurons Using Modular p-Bits
summary: Probabilistic bits (p-bits) have recently been employed in neural networks (NNs) as stochastic neurons with sigmoidal probabilistic activation functions. Nonetheless, there remain a wealth of other probabilistic activation functions that are yet to be explored. Here we re-engineer the p-bit by decoupling its stochastic signal path from its input data path, giving rise to a modular p-bit that enables the realization of probabilistic neurons (p-neurons) with a range of configurable probabilistic activation functions, including a probabilistic version of the widely used Logistic Sigmoid, Tanh and Rectified Linear Unit (ReLU) activation functions. We present spintronic (CMOS + sMTJ) designs that show wide and tunable probabilistic ranges of operation. Finally, we experimentally implement digital-CMOS versions on an FPGA, with stochastic unit sharing, and demonstrate an order of magnitude (10x) saving in required hardware resources compared to conventional digital p-bit implementations.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种模块化p-bit设计，通过解耦随机信号路径和输入数据路径，实现了可配置的概率神经元（p-神经元），支持多种概率激活函数，并在FPGA上进行了实验验证，显著降低了硬件资源需求。
AI.motivation: 现有p-bit主要用于实现sigmoid概率激活函数，而其他概率激活函数尚未得到充分探索。为了扩展p-bit的应用范围，并提高神经元设计的灵活性，需要一种能够实现多种概率激活函数的通用p-bit架构。
AI.method: 研究人员重新设计了p-bit，将随机信号路径与输入数据路径解耦，从而创建了模块化p-bit。利用这种模块化设计，实现了具有可配置概率激活函数的p-神经元，包括概率版本的Tanh、Logistic Sigmoid和ReLU激活函数。设计了基于自旋电子学（CMOS + sMTJ）和数字CMOS的电路，并在FPGA上进行了实验验证，采用了随机单元共享技术。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，模块化p-bit设计能够实现宽泛且可调的概率工作范围。在FPGA上实现的数字CMOS版本，通过随机单元共享，相比于传统的数字p-bit实现，硬件资源需求降低了一个数量级（10倍）。
AI.conclusion: 模块化p-bit设计为构建灵活、高效的概率神经网络提供了一种新的途径，有望在数据密集型计算领域得到广泛应用。该设计降低了硬件资源需求，为低功耗、低面积的神经元设计提供了新的可能性。
